title: External Chart
content:
The indicator allows “combining” several consecutive bars into bigger time intervals.

To add and set up the indicator, open the Indicators settings window.


Indicator's settings

Calculation

NameDescription
Days look back Refers to the number of previous days taken into account when calculating an indicator.

Grid

NameDescription
Show Grid Determines whether to display the border of the clusters.
Color Defines the color of the grid.

Visualization

NameDescription
Show as candle If enabled, displays the element as a candle.
Bullish color Sets the color for elements with a bullish direction.
Bearish color Sets the color for elements with a bearish direction.
Background bullish Defines the background fill color of the bullish element.
Background bearish Defines the background fill color of the bearish element.
Width Sets the width of the border of the displayed element (in pixels).
Line Style Sets the border line style of the displayed element.

Options:
  • Solid
  • Dash
  • Dot
  • Dash Dot
  • Dash Dot Dot
Fill candles Determines whether the displayed element should be filled.
Show above chart Determines whether the visual elements are drawn above or below the price data on a chart. When enabled, it overlays the indicator's graphics over the price plot.

Timeframe

NameDescription
External period Allows you to select one of the available timeframes.

Options:
  • M1
  • M5
  • M10
  • M15
  • M30
  • Hourly
  • H2
  • H4
  • H6
  • Daily
  • Weekly
  • Monthly
